page.title: 16FIRE SERVICE - BROUGH
page.content: Brough Fire Service is sited at British Aerospace, and recently became a Retained Station. It is manned by 14 factory workers, each equipped with a signal unit operated from a control point to which there is a maximum five minute response. The firemen have a two_hour training session weekly, participating in lectures and drills. They are drilled as paid firemen, not just classified as such, and are paid an annual retainer as well as for call outs and drills. Uniforms and un_dress uniforms are provided free. The station has a water ladder engine, holding 400 galls and 13.5 m. ladder, and a water tender holding 400 galls and a 10.5m. ladder. Each crew comprises 6 men. If a major incident causes the main station in Hull to use all their equipment, Brough equipment is sent to West Hull on standby.
